content.raw:
I'm inclined to close this issue since it's not a bug and it's questionable whether it would be a nice feature to offer, given that the calculated velocity would only be some sort of estimate. 

Downstream users can create a `ModelPlugin`, connect to the `WorldUpdate` event and store as many of the last positions as they see fit. Then based on those positions, calculate the instantaneous velocity as desired. See the [ActorPlugin](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/e223d73164033c14944911d68b04323f86e48f99/plugins/ActorPlugin.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default) for an example model plugin which has a callback at every world update.

I'm inclined to close this issue since it's not a bug and it's questionable whether it would be a nice feature to offer, given that the calculated velocity would only be some sort of estimate.

Downstream users can create a ModelPlugin, connect to the WorldUpdate event and store as many of the last positions as they see fit. Then based on those positions, calculate the instantaneous velocity as desired. See the ActorPlugin for an example model plugin which has a callback at every world update.
